subject: p10715477
Impression: AP chest compared to : Large cardiomediastinal silhouette has not changed appreciably since at least , early postoperatively. Moderate-to-severe cardiomegaly is comparable to the preoperative appearance. Small bilateral pleural effusions persist. There is no longer any pulmonary edema. ET tube and left internal jugular line are in standard placements and a nasogastric tube passes into the stomach and out of view. No pneumothorax.
